Name: Heroes of Hedra
Description:
Heroes of Hedra is a quick dice game that uses a standard set of polyhedral dice (RPG dice) to pit players against each other in a free-for-all battle of luck and skill. The base rules are freely available, and the game was conceived to be played before or during a tabletop role playing session, while everyone has their dice out.

Using their dice, which represent six heroes with unique abilities and one mighty dragon, players attempt to defeat their opponents' heroes to control battlefields and score points. Dice have varying levels of power, that, combined with their abilities, encourage strategic play and positioning as well as carefully thought-out risk taking.

All-in-all, Heroes of Hedra is a quick, fun game that can be played many times in a sitting, or as single quick game to pass the time, but has more strategy than one might expect.

—description from the designer

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Guilds of Ravnica
Description: Guilds of Ravnica is the 79th Magic expansion. It was released on October 5, 2018. Officially, it is not part of a block. However, it is part of a series of three that is set on the same world, unofficially called the Guilds of Ravnica block.

Name: Admiral Zheng He
Description:
Trade and travel with the Chinese fleet in the 15th century Indian Ocean.

You are a Chief Trader in this fleet, which carries costly cargoes for you to exchange for gems, incense, medicine, pearls, resin, spices, textiles, fine woods and fauna.

You decide which of these products to bring to trade with foreign ports, and using the knowledge that you alone possess, which ports to visit. The one who brings home the treasure that most impresses the Emperor wins. Includes board, 150+ cards, 24 cubes, 20 arrow chits, 3 fleet tokens, rules book with extensive background material.

A basic round of play:

     Draft Trade Goods.
     Vote on where to sail next.
     Adjust prices per the port card.
     Auction off available commodities.


—description from the designer
Families: Players: Games with expansions that add solo play

Name: Detective: City of Angels – Gen Con 2019 Promo Cards
Description: An additional Grift card (Convention) and an additional Favor card (Gentle Connie - Confidence Woman) for use in Detective: City of Angels.
Families: Game: Detective – City of Angels (Van Ryder Games)

Name: Light Hunters: Wind of the Dunes & Tide of Atlantis
Description:
Light Hunters: Wind of the Dunes & Tide of Atlantis is the second expansion for Light Hunters. This expansion can be combined with the base game or any combination of expansion.

When playing with Wind of the Dunes & Tide of Atlantis expansion, the base game rules don't change, although new gameplay are added for each of new Heroes. 8 new Heroes can be drafted by the players at the beginning of the game.

Heroes have tokens associated to their skills making them last more than 1 round.

—description from the publisher

Name: Resonance
Description:
A stolen love, a business prejudice, an unforgivable mistake, …  
You have so many reasons to seek revenge. And there are many demons that can give you this satisfaction...

Resonance is a wicked game of observation and manipulation, set during a hazardous ritual of black magic.

Your quest for revenge has brought you this far, where the border of Hell is the most fragile. You will need a full lunar month to open a passage and summon the demon that will serve you.

But you are not the only one to have had the idea of playing with the dark forces to achieve your purpose. Demonstrate skill, determination and of course spells to ensure the pursuit of your goals.

Resonance is a game for 3 to 8 witches which lasts about twenty minutes per game.
Game rounds are nothing more than the different phases of the Moon. Each phase of the Moon corresponds to a slot on the summoning circle, and you have Ritual Objects such as Herbs, Minerals and Potions to place on these 8 slots.
If the right combination of Ritual Objects resonates with the Moons, you pass one of the 3 steps required to summon your demon.

The first witch to complete the summoning ritual wins the game.

Play quickly to leave no respite to your opponents, carefully manipulate the course of this adventure and above all do not let victory escape you!

—description from the publisher

Name: Warfighter: Modern Expansion #50 – Kandahar
Description:
On May 7th, 2011 an estimated 50 Taliban began their Spring Offensive to take back Kandahar. Their goal was to show there was no loss in morale among the insurgents since Osama bin Laden's death. They attacked Afghanistan forces with RPG's and suicide bombers, with a high focus on government buildings. Their increased numbers were due to a prison escape 2 weeks earlier from Sarposa Prison, from which they gained skilled fighters and bombs experts. Fighting commenced over several days, ending when Afghan police forced a little over two dozen Taliban militants back into a hotel, where Afghan police opened fire from rooftops, showing the Insurgents that they will not allow the Taliban to rise back to power in Kandahar.

Warfighter Modern Expansion - #50 Kandahar  includes Afghanistan Soldiers, Weapons, Missions, Objectives, and Locations specific to this Battle as well as Elite RPG Teams, and Suicide Bombers. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


     3 Player Soldiers    
     3 Non-Player Soldiers
     2 Squad Soldiers 
     5 Weapons 
     4 Skills
     5 Missions
     5 Objectives
     12 Locations
     17 Hostiles


—description from the publisher

Name: Valhalla: Dawcy Krwi
Description:
A promo which was given to people donating their blood ("Dawcy Krwi" is Polish term for "Blood Donors") at Pyrkon 2019 within a bigger set "Talia Kart Krewni Pyrkonu" made up of similarly themed promos for various games by various publishers.

Some copies were also provided to various bloggers in the board gaming scope who themselves distributed them further by their own means and ways.

Name: Mein Tier zu mir
Description:
This is a game for very small children (18 months and above). 
It guides the child from free play to a first understanding of rules and taking turns.

Each player selects an animal and the corresponding game board. The 16 small plates are mixed and turned upside down. Taking turns, the players turn over one plate and may take the plate if it matches their game board. If not, they have to return the plate to the original place they took it from (players should try to memorize the location).
Whoever manages to collect all their four animal plates wins.

These are other variations the game offers (progression in difficulty):

     Talking about the animals and what they are doing in the pictures
     Puzzle in the cardboard animals
     Hide the cardboard animals and find them again
     Imitate the movements of the animals on the cards (and then you will be allowed to add the plate to your game board)

Name: Thanos Rising: Avengers Infinity War – Nick Fury Promo Card
Description:
Originally available at Gen Con 2019.

Ability: Each time you recruit another hero, remove one damage from a hero not on a player's team and draw a bonus token.

Name: Thanos Rising: Avengers Infinity War – Ant-Man Promo Card
Description:
Originally available at Gen Con 2019.

Ability: Once per turn, discard a bonus token to remove one damage from a hero and a counter from an Infinity Stone.

Name: Thanos Rising: Avengers Infinity War – Captain Marvel Promo Card
Description:
Originally available at GenCon 2019.

Ability: Roll an extra die of your choice each turn.  If you have a Battle, Technology, and Mystic hero on your team, roll two extra dice instead.

Name: Thanos Rising: Avengers Infinity War – Sanctuary-2 Promo Card
Description:
Originally available at GenCon 2019.

Ability: If Thanos is in this sector, add one Damage to the most damaged heroes in all sectors.

Name: Pike & Shotte: To Kill a King
Description:
168 pages of colour rich information with an introduction by writer Charles Singleton, this supplement for Pike & Shotte describes the history, armies, personalities and battles of the English Civil War. Included are detailed scenarios based on some of the most famous battles, complete with maps and orders of battle/army lists for the main protagonists.

Crammed full of detailed background information, including:

The Early Reign of Charles I
The Bishops’ Wars and the Short Parliament
Rebellion in Ireland
The First Civil War
The Second Civil War
Another War with Scotland
Plus a comprehensive Civil War Timeline and detailed look at the armies of the civil war who were the infantry, the cavalry and artillery, how were they organised and fielded.

The author then takes you on through the tactics of the Civil War and the military revolution of the period where the Dutch and Swedish systems were learnt and employed, and indeed explained here in detail along with more Civil War tactics.

Profiles of the Royalist and Parliamentarian Commanders.
Full colour guide to the colours used by participants in the Civil War.
Early war army lists for the Scots Covenanter Army of the Bishops’ Wars.
Bishops’ Wars Scots Royalist and English Pre Civil War Army.
The Royalist Army Lists

The Early Royalist Army
The King’s Oxford Army
The Early Oxford Army
The Late Oxford Army
The Royalist Cornish Army, 1643
The Royalist Western Army, 1644
The Royalist Northern Army
Welsh Marshes and the Anglo-Irish
Royalist Army
Battle Scenarios include:

The Battle Of Brentford 12 November 1642
The Battle Of Chalgrove Field 18 June 1643
The Battle Of Adwalton Moor 30 June 1643
The Battle Of Lansdown Hill 5 July 1642
plus a battle report for the battle of Nantwich 24 January 1644

The Parliamentarian Army Lists covering:

The Army under Lord Essex
The Armies of Sir William Waller
Fairfax’s Northern Army
The Army of the Eastern Association
Clubmen Army
The New Model Army
Specific Battle Scenarios include:

The Battle Of Cheriton 19 March 1644
The Battle Of Omskirk 20 August 1644
The Battle Report Of The Second Battle Of Newbury 27 October 1644
The Battle Of Wistanstow 8 June 1645
The Battle Of Torrington 16 February 1646
The Scottish Army Lists include:

Scots Covenanter
The Scots Royalist Army of the Marquis of Montrose
The Scots Royalist Army of 1644
The Scots Royalist Army of 1645
The ‘Traditional’ Montrose Army
Further battle scenarios look at:

The Battle Of Aberdeen 13 September 1644
Battle Report For The Battle Of Inverlochy 2nd February 1645
The Battle Of Benburb 5 June 1646
The Battle Of Winwick Pass 19 August 1648
The Irish Army Lists Include:

The Irish Catholic Confederate
Anglo-Scots Army
Ormond Irish Royalist Alliance Army
Plus

Special 'Period’ specific rules
’Late Misery of War' 8 pages of detailed campaign rules
10 pages of glorious siege rules
Concluding with the storming of Cirencester

Name: Sea Knights
Description:
What's Sea Knights?

"In the beginning was Naval War, and the AH sought that was a good game.Then was Victory in the Pacific and players were happy.Players tried to link together the games but realized that the rules were different ...And was crying and gnashing of teeth.Then, come Victory at Sea (I and II) and the Light was!"

Why SK?
VaS was realized to satisfy players' desire to play all the WWII at sea but was a hit and miss work due the deep differences between the two games and the limited historical knowledge available half a century ago, becoming a melting pot where almost any player added his personal interest more than the historical one.

SN emergence
After five years spent searching, evaluating, proposal, players' notes (and reading about 50Kg of new books with new datas) we  produced a game that gaves you the taste of the WWII war at sea linking together the PTO (fine for start) and the ETO (a real nightmare for the Axis player) in an epic day of play between 2-4 players that, as in the real war, are reluctant allies as, at the end of game, the winner will be only one.

Moreover, all the prepub ordered boxes will also include ADRIA, the WWI Naval game about the Austrian Italian war in the Adriatic Sea, a game by ENRICO ACERBI, one of the best italian game designer.

—description from the designer

Name: Hurricane Ball
Description: In Hurricane Ball, each player has a goal card showing the color of plastic balls they want in a particular order in their slots of the shared central device. When you press the lever on top of the device, the balls start hopping around, ideally landing in the player slots. If you don't like the ball color in a slot, press the lever to eject the ball and put it back into play. Get the right balls in the right slots, press the button on top, and you win!

Name: Rajas of the Ganges: Goodie Box 1
Description:
Rajas of the Ganges: Goodie Box 1 contains expansions for Rajas of the Ganges.

The Goodie Box will contain the following expansions:
- Mango Village (first released as part of the Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017)
- Tiger (first released as part of the Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018)
- Shalimar aka Snake (first released as part of the Deutscher Spielepreis 2018 Goodie Box)
as well as the following new modules:
- Test of Fate
- Gemstone Dealers (including 4 meeples)
- 2 new River Tiles
- 2 new Mango Villages

Name: Jumble Chef
Description:
Cooperative game for little ones. Players collect ingredients to cook dinner for guest. They must do it in time by his arrival to win.
For one game players choose 3 dishes they will cook. There are 20 fields with ingredients in enviroment on one side and ready dish on another side in the game. Players put 3 fields into the box ingredients side up and start a round. There are tasks for each dish how many ingredients they must collect. 
Players roll 3 marbles on a field taking turns. Player gets ingredient if marble stops on this ingredients zone. 
Guest makes one step each throw. If guest made 21 steps before all 3 dishes are cooked dinner is failed. If dinner is ready players win.
There are dishes with different quantity of ingredients to choose complexity.

—description from the publisher

Name: Last Pup Standing
Description:
Last Pup Standing is a puppy themed card game for 2-5 players. The goal of the game is to use puppy power to defend your bones and be the Last Pup Standing. There are three kinds of cards. Bone cards are your health in the game, when you run out, you're out of the game. Puppy cards are used to destroy other players' bones. There are also several special cards in the game that you can use to defeat your opponents.

—description from the designer

Name: Beasts: Edge of Extinction – Argentavis Scavenge Promo
Description:
Promo card given out at BGG con 2018 and with the Kickstarter.

Card reads: draw any two resource cards from the discard pile

Name: Fake News Game: Kanye Edition
Description:
Introducing the highly anticipated second edition of #FakeNews. Kanye West. The king of abstract and baffling statements. His creative and egotistical antics are as infamous as his honest lyrics. But can you sort the fact from the fake? With an enigma like Yeezus, this is more challenging than it sounds.'
—description from the publisher

Guess the 56 statement cards to be True or Fake News.
—description from the box

Name: Squirrel Wars!
Description:
Squirrel Wars! is a game of quick wits and quicker action!
Battle your friends in a struggle to be the Last Squirrel Standing, or hoard away enough acorns and
find the Golden Acorn (there’s only one!) to win.

Place a Tree Base in each of the marked spaces in the corners of the board.
Place one Tree Standee in each of the large squares on the play area.
Each player takes a health bar and sets it to 10 (once it hits Zero you're dead!)
Shuffle and place the Chance Deck on its marked space to the side of the board.
Place the Acorns within reach of all players.
Each player selects a squirrel type and mini, and places it on a square adjacent to their chosen Tree Base.
Roll 1d6 each, the player with the highest roll goes first, and play passes to the left.

ACORNS:
Acorns are a multi-function resource.
They can be used as ammo if you find a Slingshot, can be used to heal while drinking from the fountain, or in conjunction with the Golden Acorn you can collect 50 acorns to win the game (ONLY works if you also have the Golden Acorn card.).

THE GOLDEN ACORN:
Only one exists in the game, and it is hidden in the Chance Deck, you must hop around to find Chance Squares (golden outline) and test your luck to find it.

ACTION POINTS.
Each player starts their turn with 6 Action Points (AP).
These determine how many spaces you can move, and how many Actions you can take during your turn.

ATTACKING:
Roll the Combat Dice to determine whether you hit successfully, and how hard.
Your opponent can choose to roll defensively, but they must score the same or higher to block your attack. 
Once you hit Zero Health - You're out of the game unless someone pulls the Night of the Scampering Dead, or you have enough acorns to burn for a once-only resurrection!

CHANCE CARDS:
If you land on a Gold Square, you must draw from the chance deck.
You must read the card aloud, and follow the directions on the card BEFORE continuing your turn.
E.G ‘You drop and break your acorn!! Lose 1 Acorn’
There are Three main types of cards – Boon, Bane and Surprise! cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Duelin' Dungeons
Description:
Dueling dungeon is a game of quick reflexes and pattern recognition.
For 2 players.
Player 1 is the Adventurer, Player 2 is the Monster Master.
Players take turns laying cards from their respective decks, creating a path through the dungeon.
Each piece shows the path, various twists and turns, each player must beat the combination of symbols on the previous card to keep building the dungeon.
If there is a tie, it can be resolved with a powerup from your Tie Breaker deck!
The Adventurer wins by successfully escaping the dungeon!
The Monster Master wins by trapping the Adventurer in his throne room!

Current art is prototype, the final iteration of the game will be a refined version of this artwork.

—description from the designer

Name: Chaka!
Description:
Chaka! is an interactive party game. The goal is easy: players try to get rid of their chips. But with every chip placed, a different ability is triggered. Abilities impair, confuse and fool the players while stacking: sometimes, you need to close your eyes, stack in slow motion or you aren't allowed to use your thumbs! Can you manage to master all of the hilarious effects?

—description from the publisher

Name: Legends of Wrestling: Color Starter Set
Description: Everything you need to start playing the Legends of Wrestling card game!  This game edition includes 16 new game cards featuring the best of the Legends of Wrestling game and the Legends of Wrestling Handbook, featuring bios for all wrestlers.  This set also includes starter instructions and charts.

Name: Wan Wan Touch: The Boardgame
Description:
Wan Wan Touch is a dexterity soccer game from Nigeria. The game is a version of a popular street soccer game where players can only touch/play the ball once. The game can be played by 2-4 players and takes between 30-60 minutes to play. The game is suitable for anyone from the age of 7 years and above.

How to Play:

Any player who has last seen a soccer game begins the game by attacking any player; except when the game is in play. To begin any rounds, players must make sure the ball is on the Service Spot in front of their own post to attack. Then turn goes clockwise

In the boardgame, each of the up to 4 players defends their own cardboard goal as well as try to score other player. On a turn, a player flips the ball token forward by pressing a stick onto it (player MUST only touch/play the ball once at their turn)

Defending:

To defend, players place their playing stick in front of their own post to stop other players shot from entering the post. However, this can only be done when the ball is in their own ‘Threat zone’ (This is marked by a box). If the ball is not in the threat zone, players cannot block their post.

Beginning a round:

1.    Once the game has begun, when a ball goes out of play/pitch, the player whose side it is that the ball went out of the pitch begins the round. 
2.    Any player who is scored begins the next round.

Scoring:

Players score by shooting the ball into any player’s goal post.

Counting Scores:
Each players has 5 score point to reach in other to win the game. When a player scores any other player, they move their token on Point 1. They continue to move their token as they score. They aim to score 5 points to win.

Point deduction/Conceding

Players loose a point if they are scored when their token are on the RED point mark (3,4,5). If they are on the WHITE point mark (1,2), they are not affected when they concede a goal.

Winner: 
The first player to successfully reach the Point 5 mark wins the game.

Name: Dragonrealm: Hidden Treasure! Expansion
Description:
This mini expansion adds four hidden treasure cards to the draw deck, and ten face-down treasure tokens. Upon a player drawing or revealing a hidden treasure card, it's immediately discarded and a random hidden treasure token is taken by that player. Most of the tokens are kept secret for end game scoring, while some will allow the player to draw a random level 1 Enhancement card.

—user summary

Name: Moonstone: Shadow Glade Troupe box
Description:
This troupe box includes 3 fairy heroes of Dominion fraction.
This miniatures are made in fine quality resin. Every miniature requires assembly.

Butterfingers is a fairy that can evade enemy attacks and push enemies away using magic.
Wasp is a fairy solder that is extremely skillful with the buckler shield and healing by damaging enemies by the darts.
Silvertongue - rogue and trickster. Have some mind-control abilities.

—description from the publisher

Name: Never Have I Ever: Girls Edition
Description:
Never Have I Ever: Girls Edition is a party game. Everyone gets 10 Play Cards and takes a turn reading a Rule Card. During each round players have a chance to admit whether they're 'guilty' or 'not guilty' of a Play Card. If you're guilty, you get to keep it. First person to collect 10 Play Cards wins.

The game has 224 cards specially curated for girls. It also have 8 custom paddles, and a spinner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Moonstone: Blood Magic Troupe Box
Description:
This troupe box includes 3 new fairy heroes of Dominion fraction.
This miniatures are made in fine quality resin. Every miniature requires assembly.

Diana, Queen of the Fae is a wizard fairy, that can drain life energy from allied fairy units to heal herself. 
Foxglove is a wizard fairy that could protect allied forces and affects atrophy in enemy units.
Belladonna is alchemist and rogue fairy.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dreamscape: Red Raven
Description:
Lurking in the shadows, it is there. This oppressive presence, you always felt it. Guiding your steps to the darkest recesses of your dreams, you hardly dare to look at it when it finally appears on your way.

Sometimes you chase it, gathering enough strength to face your nightmares, but you know that sooner or later it will be watching you, darkening your sweetest dreams. Will you finally be able to free yourself from its harmful hold?

—description from the publisher

Name: Word Whizz
Description: Choose one of 30 word wheels. Players have two minutes to come up with as many words as possible from the combination of letters on the word wheel. Players must use the letter in the center of the word wheel within every word. Each word must be at least three letters long. Each player receives one point for each word, an additional point for a word of six or more letters, and ten points if all nine letters of the word wheel is used in a word.

Name: Dreamscape: White As Snow
Description:
Cradled by the gentle pulsing warmth of a fireplace, your thoughts wander back to sunny winter afternoons; invigoranting cold, the snow crunching under your feet, the snowballs flying and the big, round snowmen.

The snow invited itself into your musings, so whether it is to stack it up to and form cute parts of landscapes, to melt it under your feet, or to help you slide a bit further in your dreams, you’re the only one to choose how to play with it!

—description from the publisher

Name: Taboo: Kids vs. Parents
Description:
Kids vs. Parents edition of the TABOO game. The game includes 2 decks of cards featuring a deck designed especially for kids, featuring a familiar guess word and only 2 forbidden words on each card. Players race against the included timer as they give clues to get team players to guess as many words as they can within a minute. But don't mention unmentionables, or it's time for the squeaker, which means losing the point. The game includes over 1,000 guess words on 260 cards -- 130 cards for adults, and 130 cards designed with younger kids in mind.

—description from the publisher

Name: Okinawa!
Description:
"Okinawa!" is a two-player wargame recreating the land, sea, and air struggle for the possession of the Japanese island of Okinawa, from April to June 1945. Seen as the last steppingstone for the final jump toward Japan, the battle was important for both sides. The US had to prove it could overcome enemy resistance, securing airfields, and, after the bloodbath on Iwo Jima, keeping their casualties low. The Japanese had the chance to test their new air tactics relying on simultaneous strikes from multiple groups of Kamikaze and conventional strike aircraft escorted by fighters. They also had a full Army on the island backed, with one of the highest concentrations of Japanese artillery even seen during the Pacific War. They had to hold part of the island or inflict a level of casualties on US forces to cast enough doubts on their ability to later sustain a larger operation on Kyushu and then Honshu.  Stakes were high on both sides.

The game covers the land battle for possession of Okinawa (focusing on the more military relevant southern part), and the concomitant air and naval struggle around it. On land you have Marine and Army regiments, tanks and amphibious tanks, Japanese forces that run the gamut between highly experienced machine gun battalions to raw conscripts.  At sea Carriers, battleships, Navy and Marine air groups, Japanese Kamikazes, and even Yamato’s last sorties. Even the Commonwealth makes an appearance with Task Force 57, the British Pacific Fleet.

In addition to the campaign, shorter scenarios are included as introductions to the game system, as well as highlighting critical moments of the epic struggle. We've also included designer's notes an a nice example of play.

—description from the publisher

Name: No Retreat! Battles: 1942
Description:
The usual No Retreat! Card and combat system is used, but the rule booklet is shorter than those of the NR Front series, as less special rules will be needed due to the smaller scope of each title. Each game will have its own set of event cards and Combat Tables. With usually not much than 50-60 square counters per game, with very low stacking, it’s a series of quick-playing yet realistic affairs that favours the offensive-minded player.

Each game turn will be full of on-board challenges, plus the surprise of Events cards as players vie to win in one of two different ways.  In a skilfully blended collation of classic hex-based wargaming and card-driven simulations, No Retreat! Battles stays truly story-centric, providing the proper feel of the challenges and limitations of WW2 Army or Corps commanders, while keeping the action fast and furious, keeping play downtime to a minimum for both gamers as the “non-phasing” player has ways to react to his opponent moves and attacks, putting some well-deserved sand in his well-oiled war machine.
 As in the latest No Retreat! Front series, Leader Cards are included in most battles, these cards will give each player special abilities inspired from the Qualities (or failings!) of the Commander-in-chiefs present at the Battle covered.

1942 Game - Battle Listings – Five Battles

Battle for Velikiye Luki: This Battle simulates the Soviet Offensive that  was executed against the Wehrmacht's 3rd Panzer Army during the Winter Campaign of 1942-43; with the objective of liberating that city as part of Operation Mars. Called « The Little Stalingrad of the North »  it saw a German Garrison desperately trying to break out of the embattled northern fortess. After a bloody see-saw battle, only a hundred defenders were able to escape. The variety of units fighting is quite bewildering : Ski troops, German Paratroopers, Panzers, Soviet Guard Divisions, rocket brigades, Estonian troops, Fortifications etc…

Battle for Stalingrad (Solitaire/Two-player): This Battle showcases the famous cityfight, one of the turning points of the war. The game will focus on the urban battle in and around Stalingrad. The Player will take command of the Axis forces assaulting the city; the game AI will control the Soviet defenders. Time is of the essence to achieve complete control of the city before winter! A hidden unit system will be used to simulate the low level of local battle intelligence and difficult terrain the attackers encountered battling through the blasted ruins of the city. The game can also be played two-player.

Battle for Gazala: This Battle covers the dramatic Afrika Korps counter-attack, lead by Rommel, against the prepared positions and minefields of the British 8th Army in North Africa, culminating in the capture of the Fortress of Tobruk and dramatic advance towards Egypt. Open desert terrain and quick movement abilities will make this a wild and woolly contest of will between the well-rained German Panzers plus their Italian Allies, and the British coalition troops of a dozen different nationalities. Special “Tactical” Event cards are used to put more detail into the battle strategies used by both sides’ units.

Battle for Guadalcanal: This Battle was the first major Allied offensive against the Forces of Imperial Japan. Surprised by the attack, the Japanese made three major attempts in 1942 to retake the position conquered by the US Marines around Henderson Field. A linked scenario will cover each attempt; Event card play can also influence the outcome of the seven major naval battles, but at a cost of precious resources and Victory Points. This is the first No Retreat! Game to cover the WW2 Pacific war, and effectively three games in one.

Battle for Dieppe (Solitaire): This small, quick-playing bonus Battle will put the player, controlling Canadian forces, against the insurmountable odds of gaining a foothold in the well-defended French town of Dieppe during one of the first Amphibious landing attempted by the Allies in Europe. The game AI will take gradual control of more and more German forces as time passes, so speed of execution of the mission is key. As with the Stalingrad game, the Enemy forces will be hidden at start, to be uncovered as the game advances.

—description from the publisher

Name: Snowball Fight
Description:
Characters square off in a ruthless, last-man-standing free-for-all, of winter fun! The game plays like a tabletop miniatures game, but everything you need is in one deck of cards and it only takes 15 minutes to finish.  Run, Throw, and Duck the throws of your friends.

The base deck contains three characters, their respective action decks, double-sided terrain cards and video-game-like pickup cards to spice up the play area.  The cards determine available actions, success or failure, and describe the trajectories of movement and projectiles.  Manage your hand and deck to set up the strongest throws and eliminate your opponents.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fire in the Lake: Fall of Saigon
Description:
The Great Spring Offensive
Vietnam, 1975. The Provisional Revolutionary Government was ready. After internal debate, the Communists had issued Resolution 21—the war to unify the country would continue. The Paris Peace would serve as merely one more tool in the armed struggle. In Saigon, President Thieu had known from the beginning that the ceasefire was an empty promise, but he had to accept his US ally’s hollow accords with the North. Nonetheless, he now fielded one of the world’s best equipped armies, and the victories of 1972 proved to him that it could withstand even an all-out assault from the North. While President Nixon had pledged peace with honor, his determination to enforce South Vietnam’s independence had floundered amidst the worst US presidential scandal in history. What now from Ford? From Hanoi, Le Duc Tho—the negotiator who had squared off against Kissinger in Paris—was to trek south to oversee the final push to Saigon on behalf of the Politburo. His orders: “Do not come home until victory is won.”

Mark Herman and Volko Ruhnke’s award-winning Fire in the Lake revealed the factional clashes of the US insurgency in Vietnam, from the first entry of US combat troops under Westmoreland to the ’72 Christmas bombings that teed up their negotiated withdrawal. Now, Fall of Saigon expands Fire in the Lake to finish the story. Three Fall of Saigon scenarios enable 1-4 players to extend play beyond Paris, beginning before 1968’s Tet, on the eve of the 1972 Easter Offensive, or from 1964 all the way to the end of the war. A standalone 2â€‘player Black April scenario focuses tightly on the post-Paris sparring between NVA and ARVN, including the final massive battles, advances, and retreats.

To show the transition from insurgency and counterinsurgency to mobile mechanized warfare, Fall of Saigon introduces an array of new features, including:


     Paris Peace Talks that may result in either US or NVA Retreat—or both.
     A building US Anti-War Movement and Northern War Weariness penalizing the continued campaigns.
     US Posture that players influence to allow anything from full-bore US economic and financial backing of ARVN’s defense and even a return of US heavy bombers over the North to utter abandonment of South Vietnam.
     Hard-hitting NVA and ARVN Armor units capable of lightning Spearhead actions and of capturing the enemy’s vehicles to turn around for their own use in the next attack.
     Head-to-head action, NVA versus ARVN, using the acclaimed 2-player Initiative system from COIN Series Volume VII, Colonial Twilight, by Brian Train.
     72 new Event cards for 1973-1975 and four new Pivotal Events to portray the political struggles in Washington, Hanoi, and Saigon; the building conventional military capabilities of the combatants; NVA probes and ARVN counterthrusts; threatened US enforcement of the Accords by air; and the chaos of the final collapse.
     For solitaire players, Fall of Saigon introduces the popular new card-based Non-player system from Bruce Mansfield, designer of COIN Series Volume IX, Gandhi.


Fall of Saigon will include 79 Event, Pivotal Event, and Coup cards; about 30 Non-player cards; one sheet of counters and track tiles; about 20 added wooden pieces; new and updated player aid charts; and expansion rule and play booklets. Fire in the Lake veterans will find the war beyond Paris easy to rev up but a whole new experience.

A copy of Fire in the Lake will be necessary to play the Fall of Saigon expansion.

COMPONENTS

    79 playing cards (Fall of Saigon Events, Coups, Pivotals - S1 to S79).
    25 tarot-sized playing cards (FoS solitaire system).
    24 wooden pieces (9 Red, 15 yellow)
    4 identical double-sided color 11x17” cards (FoS Faction sheets).
    2 identical double-sided color 8½x11” cards (FoS Coup Round and Paris Peace sheets).
    2 different double-sided color 11x17” cards (FoS Non-Player Coup Round).
    2 different double-sided color 8½x11” cards (FoS Non-Player Aid).
    1 Countersheet (US Policy tile, Initiative track tile, 39 Fall of Saigon counters).
    Expansion Rules booklet
    Playbook booklet
    Solitaire (Tay Son) Rules and Reference booklet
    Game Box


 
Errata components also included for Fire in the Lake:

    2 counters
    1 Playing card (solitaire system - US card B)


(from GMT website and user's description)

Name: Dreamscape: Dream Creatures
Description:
Your dreams host every kind of inhabitants most of the time discreet. You could meet one at any time, hiding in the bend of a path. And you would be surprised to discover that those tiny creatures don’t ask much to follow you.

Sometimes clever, sometimes playful, and all different, this Dream Creatures ask a small price for the precious help they are ready to provide.

Are you willing to lure them?

—description from the publisher

Name: Dreamscape: Will'O the Wisp
Description:
Night after night, roaming your Dreamscape, you end up believing it holds no secret for you anymore. But when you see for the first time the eyes of a Wisp, you immediately understand how wrong you were. You remember some tales of the ancients, mentioning those tiny creatures waiting for a kind soul to show them the way to follow, in exchange for granting tremendous wishes.

It is decided! Saving these cute Wisps from limbo will become part of your mission,and for sure, Will O’ The Wisp won’t forget your brave actions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Robotech: Invid Invasion
Description:
Weary from the constant battle with the Robotech Masters, the United Earth Forces have fallen to the invasion of the insect-like alien Invid. Lt. Commander Scott Bernard leads a tight-knit team of freedom fighters toward the main base of the alien invaders located at Reflex Point. Their only hope for liberating the Earth is to defeat the Invid aliens and their Queen Regess before Admiral Hunter’s Expeditionary Force returns to raze the planet and end the threat to the galaxy.

Can you can you and the other freedom fighters defeat the Regess and save the Earth?

+++

Robotech: Invid Invasion is a Cooperative game where human heroes must work together to cleanse Reflex Point of the alien Invid Invaders and their Queen Regess before it’s too late.

During the first phase, players will deal out a grid of facedown Invid Cards. Each turn, players will move their hero(es) around the grid, choosing which Invid Cards to flip over to potentially expose enemies, ambushes, or valuable Allies. The heroes must clear a path from one side of the board to the other to reach Reflex Point before the end of six (6) turns.

Once the path to Reflex Point is cleared, the heroes begin the Regess phase. The Regess and her guards are dealt out, along with additional Invid warriors. Our heroes must defeat the powerful Regess within six turns. If they fail, the returning REF will end the Invid threat—and our unfortunate heroes—by bombarding the planet with the dreaded Neutron-S missiles.

To win, the heroes must clear the path to Reflex point and defeat the Regess at Reflex Point before the missiles fall, destroying all life on the planet.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gemblo Trio
Description: Gemblo Trio is an abstract strategy game with translucent, colored pieces, each of which is made up of one to five hexagons. Each player has an identical set of pieces in a unique color. The goal is to get rid of all of your pieces by placing them on the hexagonal game board. Each piece that you place after the first cannot touch previously-placed pieces of the same color; instead each piece must be a distance of "1" from another piece of the same color, where 1 is the length of a side of one of the small hexagons. Another restriction is that the distance being measured can't directly cross another player's piece, but it can lie at the junction of two pieces. Once all players have placed as many pieces as they can, they count the number of hexagonal units in the pieces they couldn't place, and the player with the lowest score wins.

Name: Ultra Quick Baseball
Description:
The purpose of this game is to quickly simulate scores and standings for baseball leagues.  You can use the game as a companion to a play-by-play baseball game, or as a stand-alone game in which you play out the season and watch the pennant races unfold.
 Each team is accurately rated for their hitting, pitching and defense as well as how they perform when playing at home and how they handle pressure situations.  The combination of these ratings gives you a very accurate picture of each team.  In addition to the team ratings, we also provide you with a quick and simple method for normalizing teams across eras.  So, you can effortlessly determine the best team of all time if you choose, without worrying about any biases.

As the name implies, the games play out Ultra Quick! Now you can finally complete that full baseball season on your tabletop with Ultra Quick Baseball.

You'll need an Ultra Quick Season Year Book to play the game.

Name: Vindication: Board Game Spotlight Promo Cards
Description:
Two promo cards ("Spotlight Enchantress" and "Spotlight Hotshot") which were available as a reward for the 2019 Board Game Spotlight "Promo Paradise" Kickstarter.

Spotlight Enchantress (Companion): Gain 1 inspiration or 1 strength if you have none.

Spotlight Hotshot (Companion): Gain 1 knowledge or 1 inspiration if you have none.

Name: Vindication: Dice Tower 2019 Promo Cards
Description:
Two promo cards ("The Rice Tower" and "Suzanne & Mandi") which were available as a reward for the 2019 Dice Tower Kickstarter.

The Rice Tower (Relic): Return 1 influence; also return 1 influence from each companion you control.

Suzanne & Mandi (Companion): Roll the white attribute die twice. Choose one result and gain that attribute. If they match, gain both.

Name: Ultimate Troll Episode 2: Steampunk Tycoon
Description:
â€‹Episode 2: Steampunk Tycoon can be played as a standalone game focusing on new mechanics and play styles. However it can also be mixed in with it's predecessor, Episode 1: Dawn of Voyaging Troller, for a larger and longer game with up to 2 additional players per box mixed in.

This mix of the old and new give birth to countless new ways to betray your friends and steal their things. Most important of which are cogs, a new way to gain compound interest on certain cards and scoring oodles of points (yes I said oodles).

—description from the publisher

Name: Building Cities
Description:
Building Cities is a game for 1-4 players, a modern city simulation where you can build, manage, expand and maintain your own city!

It offers many challenges, both in single player and multiplayer versions. 
You will have 10 turns to build road tiles or buildings, according to the Engineer's Handbook and your Bank Account, and at the end of your turn you will draw and Event Card.
The 200 cards you will find in the game box are divided into Objectives, Events and Challenges. 
Objectives will be used only at the beginning of the game (the same goal for every player, E.g. Build 12 Offices, a Legendary Building and the Airport), Events are the cards that you will draw at the end of each round, Challenges, finally, will be cards drawn every 4 rounds after the creation of the second District, a sort of Event Cards but more cruel (E.g. Some criminals stormed up a cargo ship. Remove a ship if you don't have a Task Force card to cancel this Challenge)!
The single-player version it’s a pleasant pastime, moreover, you can become familiar with the game mechanics, road construction (curves, intersections, straights) and with the placement of buildings in the most strategic and useful way (where will we put the Police Station? And the Hospital? And if their range doesn’t satisfy the whole districts?). 
In fact, you could find yourself in some unpleasant situations, where, a faulty District might preclude you some possibilities! Or, even worse, making lose you the goals!
In multi player mode, imagine a situation where 3 mayors join forces against one, literally making it out to the sound of Challenge cards, or excluding him from trade routes or even blow a Legendary Building out of his nose during the auction, (perhaps useful for completing a goal)! 
It will also be possible to play in teams, 2vs2, and see which of the two teams manages to make 1 of their mayors stand out before the opponents. And... What if someone betrays his coalition? You decide how to play, the rules leaves you carte blanche!
There’s another way called Fair Play Mode, where players decides to play without "throw a monkey wrench in the works". Who, first, completes the goal revealed by the card drawn at the start of the game, eliminating the auction for Legendary Buildings, will win the game.
Building Cities has very high replayability, where every game will be different from the previous one!

—description from the publisher

Name: Shelfit!
Description:
You all went to boardgame auction, and bought a lot of games. Now it is time to split them, and put them on shelves.

Shelfit! is a roll and shelve game - roll and write where one player rolls the dice, and splits them into as many groups as there are players, then each player chooses one group, and what is left the player who rolled the dice gets. Then players draw the games to the shelves, trying to reach one of the scorings for each shelf they have filled.

—description from the publisher

Name: Heimweg
Description:
The night is dark. Five frightened passengers stare through the foggy windows while the car crawls slowly through the unknown area. It seems these parts of the woods were untouched by civilization for a couple of decades. The headlights just barely light up the winding roads and lead the vehicle deeper into the darkness...

Heimweg – the German word for “the way home” – is a story-driven cooperative dice-game for 1 to 5 players. Each player takes the role of a passenger that holds a dark secret. The players win together when their ride reaches its destination. But beware: the players need to reveal their dark secrets, watch out for car trouble, navigate through the unknown forest and try to keep the engine running.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shinobi Shogi
Description:
Shinobi-Shogi is a strategic game, it's rule is based on Shogi, a Japanese Chess like game.You move your "Shinobi*" onto the opponent's "Shinobi" and defeat it. After defeating a "Shinobi", you can play that "Shinobi" face down and hiding its roll as your own "shikigami**". Foil the opponent's design and take advantage to defeat the opponent's Princess!

- *Shinobi (=å¿å°¾) is mythtical fox ninja 
- **Shikigami is like magical summoned servants

—description from the designer

Name: Eid
Description:
Eid refers to the Muslim festival, Eid al-Adha which honors the willingness of Ibrahim (Abraham) to sacrifice his son as an act of obedience to God's command. But, before Abraham could sacrifice his son, God provided a lamb to sacrifice instead. Eid al-Adha is a Festival of the Sacrifice and families celebrate with prayers, charity, social gatherings, and Festive Meals!

In Eid, players will be going to the market to try to get all the ingredients they need to complete the recipes before the other player does. Players will gain ingredients by altering the current market for ingredients and then trading away their current ingredients to get more of another.

Players will alter the market by playing a card to a two-sided function. The player will then use that function to trade in one type of ingredient to gain the ingredients listed on the other side of the function. Play will continue until one player has completed two of the three recipe cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Median
Description:
Median is a fast-paced, exciting party game that will have you and your friends laughing, guessing, and strategizing your way to victory! In each round, one player will read a trivia question out loud and then everyone will write down their answer on a piece of paper. Once everyone has submitted their answers, they are organized in ascending order and the player(s) who wrote the answer that's in the middle of all answers (hence the name "Median") wins that round!

But here's the twist: you don't actually need to know the correct answer to win. In fact, sometimes the funniest or least-likely answer will be the one that ends up in the middle! This can add an element of strategy to the game, as you have to think about what other players might write and try to come up with an answer that will put you in the winning spot.

Whether you're a trivia buff or just looking for a fun and lighthearted party game, Median is sure to provide hours of entertainment and laughter. So gather your friends, grab some pens and paper, and get ready to play the game that's all about the middle!

—description from the designer

Name: Soy What?!
Description:
Soy What?! is a sweet and fun card game that plays vegans and meat eaters in a spicy battle for the best meals.
    
Goal:    
The goal of the game is to collect the most food points and not get food poisoning.

Setup:    
Each player gets a secret role (vegan or meat eater) and a food allergy card. Additionally every player gets 5 cards. 
All other playing cards are stacked in the deck which is placed in the middle. Then the game starts clockwise.

Gameplay:    
During the game, players place food cards on the playing field and after that always take a card from the deck.
The points on each card count for either vegans or meat eaters - some cards always count.  
If certain criteria are met, the active player can or must take all cards placed. These cards then count as one meal.
A player can only have three meals. If he obtains a fourth, his first meal must be taken out of the game.

End of the Game:    
The game ends after the deck is empty and the last meal is played out. Then players reveal their roles and allergies.
If one of the collected food cards contains an allergy that the player has - the player is out.

—description from the designer

Name: Zombicide: Invader – Promo Xenos Pack
Description:
These are Xeno minis which were sold as optional buy during the Zombicide: Invader Kickstarter.

Indludes:
8 Seeker Worker figures (featuring 2 different sculpts)
6 Driller Blitzer figures (featuring 2 different sculpts)
8 Xenomoth figures
8 Flinger figures

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Canyons Artifacts #1 Game Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Canyons Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone (The Canyons are in the Blasted Wastes Deluxe OtherWorld Expansion), themed around the items found in that dusty gulch.

CONTENTS

     Card #304 Ghost Warrior Hatchet ×2
     Card #305 Letter Home ×2
     Card #306 12th Cavalry Pistol ×2
     Card #307 12th Cavalry Captain's Sabre
     Card #308 Ghost Warrior Bow
     Card #309 12th Cavalry Bugle
     Card #310 Soldier's Harmonica
     Card #311 12th Cavalry Hat
     Card #312 Dark Stone Arrowheads
     Card #313 Tribal Ghost Dance
     Card #314 Tribal Rain Dance
     Card #315 Shaman's Headdress

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Red Rock Gulch Game Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Canyons Encounters for Shadows of Brimstone (The Canyons are in the Shadows of Brimstone: Other Worlds â€“ Blasted Wastes), themed for exploring in that dusty locale.

CONTENTS

     Card #316 Watchers on the Ridge ×2
     Card #317 Smoke Signals ×2
     Card #318 The Mountain's Slumber
     Card #319 Storm Clouds
     Card #320 Something in the River
     Card #321 The Hanging Tree
     Card #322 Outlaw Trail
     Card #323 The Last Man
     Card #324 Red Rock Shootout
     Card #325 Floating Barrels
     Card #326 The Devil's Tongue
     Card #327 Firefly Valley
     Card #328 The White Buffalo

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Enemy Traits Pack #2 Supplement
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Trait cards are used to give a particular enemy type more diversity (and often a bit more danger). This is the second in a series of Trait Packs that re-visit established enemies from Shadows of Brimstone, adding unique new traits to them, and making them feel different each time you encounter them! This Card Supplement contains a set of trait cards for three different enemies from the original Swamps of Death Core Set of Shadows of Brimstone: Hell Bats, Slashers, and Hungry Dead enemies. Also included are rules for your Heroes becoming "Zombie Heroes" after being bitten by Hungry Dead!

This 17-card supplement adds a collection of Enemy Traits for Hell Bats, Slashers, and Hungry Dead Enemies for Shadows of Brimstone.

CONTENTS

     Card #273 Flooding Swarm (HellBat Trait)
     Card #274 Human Faces (HellBat Trait)
     Card #275 Charged Wings (HellBat Trait)
     Card #276 Spits Burning Bile (HellBat Trait)
     Card #277 Corpse Nesting (HellBat Trait)
     Card #278 Grave Weapons (Hungry Dead Trait)
     Card #279 Zombie Plague (Hungry Dead Trait)
     Card #280 Corrupting Gore (Hungry Dead Trait)
     Card #281 Unstoppable (Hungry Dead Trait)
     Card #282 Clawing Horde (Hungry Dead Trait)
     Card #283 Serrated Claws (Slasher Trait)
     Card #284 Void Parasites (Slasher Trait)
     Card #285 Soulless Black Eyes (Slasher Trait)
     Card #286 Feeding Mandibles (Slasher Trait)
     Card #287 Enraged by Light (Slasher Trait)
     Card #288 Zombie Bite / Zombie Hero ×2 (Rule Card)

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Shikarri Nomad Crusaders Enemy Pack
Description:
This enemy pack introduces the Shikarri. A race of aliens whose homeworld was destroyed in a cataclysm involving Dark Stone, the remaining Shikarri are fanatics scouring the universe of all that has been tainted by Dark Stone, determined to wipe the substance's corruption from the galaxy.

The enemy pack includes everything needed to add these new foes to a game of Shadow of Brimstone; models, an enemy sheet, and threat cards for multiple Other Worlds.

—description from the publisher

Name: Brücke Auf Brücke zu
Description:
The aim of the game is to get as fast as possible from the city to the island with his pawn and then back to the city with the corresponding pawn from the island. Whoever masters this fastest wins.
To get around, there are different means of transport available besides "running". Police agents, bridges and stops are inserted as obstacles.
The engines are various dices that affect the means of transport or obstacles.

Ziel des Spieles ist es mit seinem Spielstein möglichst günstig/schnell von der Stadt auf die Insel zu kommen und mit dem korrespondierenden Spielstein entsprechend von der Insel wieder zur Stadt. Wer dies am schnellsten bewältigt, gewinnt.
Zur Fortbewegung stehen neben "Laufen" auch unterschiedliche Verkehrsmittel zur Verfügung. Als Schikane sind Schupos, Brücken und Haltestellen eingefügt.
Als Motor dienen diverse Würfel, die die Verkehrsmittel bzw Schikanen beeinflussen.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Mining Lift
Description:
A limited-edition product of the DarkStone Forge, this set includes a resin cast mining lift for inclusion with the Shadows of Brimstone Mine map. Comes with two brand-new missions utilizing the lift, as well as special rules for playing with a multi-level map that allows for easier splitting up of the posse as the heroes try their best to cover as much ground as they can.

—description from the publisher

Name: Never Have I Ever: Family Edition
Description:
Never Have I Ever: Family Edition is a party game. Everyone gets 10 Play Cards and takes a turn reading a Rule Card. During each round players have a chance to admit whether they're 'guilty' or 'not guilty' of a Play Card. If you're guilty, you get to keep it. First person to collect 10 Play Cards wins.

The game has 224 cards specially curated for games with families. It also have 6 custom paddles, and a spinner.

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: Der kleine Rabe Socke: Suche nach dem verlorenen Schatz
Description:
In Der kleine Rabe Socke: Suche nach dem verlorenen Schatz (The Little Raven: Looking for Lost Treasure), players set up the game by scattering the "treasure" tokens around the deck.

During a round, players turn over cards one by one, and as soon as you've seen a treasure a second time, you can grab that item and place it in front of you. If that item is revealed again before the end of the round, though, you're eliminated from play that round! Once the round ends, players score 1-3 points depending on how many treasures they've collected. Whoever has the most points at the end of three rounds wins!

Name: Zombicide: Invader – Soldier Extras
Description:
KS Exclusives for Soldier Pledge-

Survivors - Massimo, Kilgore, 'Frank' & Doctor Fischer
Xenos - Xenium Horror Abomination (4 cards); Brood Mother Abomination (6 cards) and 8 Brood Children

Name: Zombicide: Invader – Civilian Extras
Description:
KS Exclusives for Civilian Pledge level.

39 Survivors,

Xenos - 8 Abominations (extra Spoiler; Babyface, I.R.I.S., Buddybot, Mother-In-Law, Shadow, Stomper & Widowmaker)
8x Flingers, 8x Seekers, 8x Xenmoths & 8x alt sculpt workers.

Name: 1 2 3 Good Night
Description:
Animals are fascinated with the objects left behind by humans. So, they tend to pick one for themselves when they have a chance, having some great time playing with the newfound toy. 
They are even known to be sleeping with it, cuddling it at night.
But soon enough, people want their stuff back. However, they don’t have much time to retrieve their properties. 
As one of them, you will have to find as many pairs of animals playing with the same object before your time is up!

Place all animal tiles on the table. Everyone, except the Seeker, tries to find a pair of the same animal by turning the facedown tiles and revealing them.
The tiles with the same animal have different backgrounds, night and day, so you need to look carefully.
When the game begins, the Seeker needs to find the goodnight cards in the right order: 1, 2, 3 and good night.
At the same time, everyone needs to stop and make a pose according to their pose card in front of them before the Seeker finds all the cards. If they are late, they do not receive any point.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dr. Frankenstein: Rise of the Monster
Description:
Dr. Frankenstein: Rise of the Monster is a print-and-play game designed for 2-4 players, ages 12 and up, and takes about an hour to play.

In Dr. Frankenstein: Rise of the Monster, you are a mad scientist on the brink of a momentous discovery.  Will you be the first of your peers to bring your monstrous creation to life?  Dig up body parts from the village graveyard, buy items from the workshop, and gather the resources you need to finish your work and become the greatest scientific mind of the age.  With your faithful henchman at your side, anything is possible.  But beware!  The villagers are becoming restless.  It’s only a matter of time before they form an angry mob and head for your castle—and that’s sure to send your monster into an angry rampage through the village.

Dr. Frankenstein: Rise of the Monster is a hierarchical worker placement game.  Through strategic placement of your pawns, sometimes blocking other players or bumping them to adjacent locations, you collect the resources and body parts needed to bring your monster to life.  Once alive, your monster is an additional worker which you may place to gain resources or sacrifice on a rampage through the village to score additional victory points.  Players must take care to manage the anger of the villagers by controlling the mob meter, or else the villagers might riot.  The burgomeister pawn adds a unique element of placement control and timing, though his loyalty often shifts from player to player.  Items purchased at the village workshop boost the players’ abilities to gather resources, score victory points, rampage, or control areas of the board.  Each scientist has his own special abilities which augment game play for that particular player and offer numerous pathways to victory.  The first player to 25 victory points wins!


—description from the designer

Name: Necromunda Underhive: Intrigues and Rackets Card Pack
Description:
This set contains 52 Intrigue and Racket cards for use during a Law and Misrule Campaign as presented in Necromunda: The Book of Judgement.

To use the contents of this pack you will need a copy of the Necromunda Rulebook, Necromunda: Gangs of the Underhive, and Necromunda: The book of Judgement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Necromunda Underhive: Underdog Card Pack
Description:
This set contains 26 cards for use in Necromunda games.

13 Underdog Tactics cards, 12 Gang Tactics cards and a rule card.

You will need a copy of the Necromunda Rulebook and also Necroumunda: Gangs of the Underhive to use the contents of this pack.

—description from the publisher

Name: Necromunda Underhive: Dramatis Personae Cards 1
Description:
Recruit the most feared names in the Underive to aid your gang in the fight for survival.

This set contains Fighter cards for all of the Dramatis Personae Hired Guns currently available in the game of Necromunda.  Also included is a blank Fighter card for creating your own Hired Gun, using the rules presented in Necromunda: Gangs of the Underhive.

Each card is a handy reference , detailing the fighter's profile, weapons, Wargear , skills, and cost.

—description from the publisher

Name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Promo Paradise Card Set
Description:
2 additional building cards released during the Promo Paradise Kickstarter.

Spotlight - Draw 3 cards and keep 1

Pool of Martyn - Lose 2 Silver to gain 1 Virtue
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Memoir '44: Breakthrough to Gembloux
Description:
Double-sided BREAKTHROUGH format map. Side 1 - Countryside Map. Side 2 - Breakthrough to Gembloux Scenario. Includes both English and French text.

This Memoir ‘44 Breakthrough Battle Map will take you deep into the battles of World War II with two, double-sided, 9-panel pre-printed maps. These oversize boards stretch the limit of current printing technology and are 13 x 17 hexes deep, opening up the Breakthrough format to new, more expansive scenarios.

Exists with and without an envelop.
Families: Game: Memoir '44 – The Battle Map Series

Name: Kampen om Stavanger
Description:
Kampen om Stavanger is a card game where players are politicians trying to get political issues approved. First player to gain issues worth 10 swords is the winner. Each player starts with four political issue cards and one support card.

The game consists of 48 political issues cards worth 1-3 swords, and 21 support cards. The political issues come in four colors; red (collective issues), blue (market issues), green (environmental isues) and yellow (value issues). Each issue card comes with a price market at the top; in trying to get a political issue approved, the player has to sacrifice a number of red, blue, green and/or yellow cards from her hand.

In addition, the support cards represent different organisations who can give your proposal a supporting boost; media, taxi drivers, environmentalists, pub owners, the bishop etc. Support cards has a support value and a blocking value. Support cards can substitute a number of sacrificed issue cards.

On a player's turn, the player takes two actions, and chooses from

i) Draw three issue cards 
ii) Look at opponent's hand and steal one issue 
iii) Discard two issue cards and draw one support card 
iv) Propose an issue and sacrifice the right number of cards (possibly with support).

In order to stop one player's proposal/issue, the other players can block it by

- collectively sacrificing the same number of issue cards sacrified by the proposer (support can replace issues, using the blocking value) AND 
- using at least the same number of support cards.

Stavanger is the fourth largest city in Norway, and three vertical viking swords standing in stone is a commonly used city symbol. The first edition was printed in a total of 100 copies, as part of mayor candidate Eirik Faret Sakariassens (SV) campaign for municipal office in 2019.

The game can be purchased at thegamecrafter.com (Norwegian language only).

—description from the designer

Name: The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera – Skull Detonator & Seek the Jade Colossus Promo Cards
Description:
Contains 2 promo cards for use with The Ninth World: A Skillbuilding Game for Numenera:


     Skull Detonator: Cypher: Galvanic Blast - At the start of the Tinker Phase, shuffle this into the wilderness deck to discard 1 wilderness card.
     Seek the Jade Colossus: Quest - Multiphase: To complete the tiers, first discard 1 cypher, then claim 1 creature, then advance your Tinker skill.

Name: Spin: Away Game
Description:
Simple space themed game where players spin a top and attempt to knock down small wooden pins. The pins are placed on top of images of sputnik satellites that form an orbiting ring around an image of earth. The Satellites each have a value.

Each player, in turn spins the top in the center of the box, attempting to knock over as many pins as possible to accumulate the highest score. The player with the highest score is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Farmanimo
Description:
A GAME OF COOPERATION AND TOUCH RECOGNITION
OBJECT: guide at least one animal to the pasture before the tractor returns to the farm.
To move an animal, feel around in the sack to pull out the corresponding playing piece, but beware—only a white piece moves the animal forward. If you pull a black piece, the farmer moves forward! If one of the animals arrives at the meadow before the tractor arrives at the farm, everybody wins! If not, everyone will lose.

+++  The different shapes of the animals help identify them by touch.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ραντάρ
Description:
Pantap (Radar in Greek) is a Greek electronic space board game from the 1950s where the board has two playing areas. One half has a Radar control panel and the other half is images of multi-staged rockets.

Two players each have wired playing pieces (electrodes) that the Radar player places in a choice of holes. The Rocket player places his electrode into holes located along a designated rocket. The connections then light either a red, yellow or green lamp. If a red lamp lights up the Radar player has destroyed a stage in a rocket. If yellow or green light up the Rocket player receives points.

The Radar player wins if he can destroy all the rockets by making the right connections. The rocket player wins if he can reach 100 points before his rockets are destroyed.

—user summary

Name: Cadomino
Description:
A GAME OF OBSERVATION AND SPEED
OBJECT: be the first to find 4 gifts to win the hand!
At the beginning, all dominoes are spread out on the table with the animal faces visible. The cards are in a pile, face-down. A card is turned over: it shows an animal (starting point), a colour (ending point) and the gift to be found. To find the animal hiding the gift, players silently work it out on their own: each player follows the movement of the animals to arrive at the desired colour. Once the animal has been identified, the fastest player places their finger on that animal’s square and the domino is flipped over! If it’s the right animal, the gift is hidden behind it and the player wins the card.

+++  Hint: the gift is always behind the new animal on the third domino.

—description from the publisher

Name: Potomac
Description:
A GAME OF COOPERATION
OBJECT: guide the animals to the forest by crossing the river and the clearing.
Together, the players help the 6 little animals reach the forest without any of them being swept over the waterfall or captured by the wolf roaming the clearing. Roll the dice to determine which path to take, and use your defensive cards against the wolf. When the six animals have reached the forest on the other side of the river, they’re safe and sound!

+++  Can be played with 5 little animals instead of 6 for an easier version of the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kill Die Repeat
Description:
You are sucked into a portal and awake in an arena in a different world. But you are not alone. Several other fighters from different universes wait for your arrival. Then chaos ensues.

Try to survive in this fast battle royal game for 3-8 players and be the last man standing. Put on top of that player elimination with a twist and let the fun begin.

If you don't like to fight bare-handed, use your action points and try to move over the arena floor as fast as possible. Grab items to better attack and defend yourself and best of all seek cover behind the few obstacles.

Kill Die Repeat uses an attribute-driven dice fight system. Every character has different attack and defense values as a special action to him. Upgrade him with equipment to boost your values. All characters additionally gain cosmic power every round that can be used to further boost one standard action or for executing a special action.

—description from the designer

Name: Space Builder
Description:
GAME OF OBSERVATION AND SPEED
OBJECT: be the first to build your space city, following the map instructions.
All players place a board before them facing the same way and take a set of building cards. The game is played in multiple rounds. In each round, a “map” card is turned over and placed face up in the centre. Players play at the same time, building their space city with their “building” cards according to the map instructions. Warning! Players may not turn the map card to face a different direction. You have to be fast and observant to avoid construction mistakes!

+++  A very fair game: the winner of the round has to play one more card than the other players in the next round!

—description from the publisher

Name: Gloutons!
Description:
A GAME OF OBSERVATION AND SPEED
OBJECT: earn as many “goal” cards as possible.
Each player takes a monster and tweezers and puts it in front of him or her. The strings are placed in the middle of the table where everyone can reach them. A player turns over a card. All together, the players must pick up the objects indicated on the card with their tweezers and manoeuvre them into their monster’s mouth. As soon as a player thinks he or she is finished, they yell out “Glutton” and the game stops. If no error has been made in picking up the monster, the player wins the card and places it in front of them. If the player made a mistake, the turn ends for them and the game resumes for the others until another player shouts “Glutton”.

+++  Cards with multiple levels of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

Name: Octopus
Description:
A GAME OF DEXTERITY, MANIPULATION AND COOPERATION
OBJECT: to catch fish to transfer them from one board to another.
The players work together in pairs to catch a single fish, lift it up and move it into the lagoon. If the players drop a fish on the way because they bumped into one of the giant octopus’ tentacles, or for any other reason, they will have to catch the same fish again, wherever it landed. When the sand timer runs out, if all the fish have been moved to safety, the players win; otherwise, everyone has lost!

+++  A magnetic fishing game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Movie Empire: Horror Edition
Description:
The Horror Edition is the first expansion for Movie Empire and expands the core game with a new genre.

—description from the publisher

Name: Movie Empire: Blockbuster Edition
Description:
The Blockbuster Edition is the second expansion for Movie Empire and has everything what a huge blockbuster needs: strong scripts and bankable stars.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tulum
Description:
A “STICK OR TWIST” GAME
OBJECT: to be the first to fill your pyramid with coloured blocks.
On your turn, you roll the dice. Depending on the colours showing on the dice, you can take (if you can place them) the corresponding coloured blocks and place them on your board. You can decide to stop there and then you will have definitively won the coloured blocks you picked up on your turn. OR, you can also decide to roll the unused dice again and try to collect more blocks. In this case, you roll again, and so on. BUT BEWARE, if on one of these subsequent dice rolls you cannot place a new block on your board, you lose ALL the blocks you collected during that turn. You win the game by being the first player to complete your pyramid.

+++  It is important to learn to stop in time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Potions Please
Description:
Potions Please is a fun and exciting set collection game that is friendly for all ages. 

     Choose your Witch
     Create potions and gain powers
     Quickest player to get 4 potions becomes Head Witch


What is Potions Please?
Players pick a witch with a special once per game ability. From then on, they compete to create potions by collecting ingredients, gaining powers from drinking their potions, and competing to be head witch in charge!

How to Play? 
Players collect ingredients and try to make one each of the 4 color potions. 
Turns are simple, fast and happen in four phases. 

     Ask: One your turn you must ask another player for a card, if they have it they must give it to you if they do not draw a card.
     Take: On the table are 5 cards in a conveyor belt, each turn you get 5 points to spend the card costs goes 1 from 5. You can take as many cards as you have points for. After your turn, cards are refilled on conveyor belt.
     Drink: If you have a potion at this point you will drink it and use it’s effect. Your witch's special ability may be played in this phase.
     Make: If you have all the ingredients listed on one of the potions card you can make that potion and gain that card.


First Player to get one potion of each color wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Anachrony: Future Imperfect
Description:
Future Imperfect is a modular expansion for Anachrony, with four new modules expanding the possibilities beyond new horizons. These modules are playable on their own, but they are also compatible with each other and most past and future Anachrony modules and expansions.

Neutronide Buildings offers a set of 4 new buildings that become increasingly effective the more Power Plants you have.

The Hypersync module allows you to perform a Capital action without actually placing an Exosuit, then in the future use the new Hypersync Action to make your placement affect the past. This puts serious strain on the space-time continuum, increasing the risk of Paradoxes, but often the risk is worth the reward and the flexibility. This module is supported for 1-4 players (Fractures of Time expansion required for solo play.)

With the Quantum Loops module, you are no longer limited to warping from your own timeline: the module opens up parallel universes where resources are more plentiful, the locals are eager to join your cause, or their technology allows you to shortcut your own travels through time... The possibilities multiply through a new Warp tile that grants access to the powerful Quantum Effect cards, but beware - to close a loop to a parallel universe, you will need a real Breakthrough... This module is supported for 1-4 players (Fractures of Time expansion required for solo play.)

The Intrigues of the Council module simulates the World Council's political machinations, bringing two new aspects to the game: another layer of player interaction and customizable endgame scoring objectives, influenced by the players. By sending Exosuits to the right place at the right time, players can receive bonus resources and compete to build a tableau of Agenda tiles, which replaces the base game's Endgame Condition scoring. This module is recommended for 3 or 4 players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Terramara: Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack adds the following cards to Terramara:

     2 double-sided Characters
     3 Artefacts (one per level; 1, 2 and 3)
     2 Starting Resources cards


—description from the publisher

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Void Swarms and Void Hives Enemy Pack
Description:
This enemy pack includes all the necessary materials to add two new enemies to your Shadows of Brimstone game, the Void Swarms, and their Hives. The enemy pack includes minis for both enemies, Enemy Record sheets, and all the necessary threat cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bata-Miaou
Description:
A GAME OF BATTLE
OBJECT: get all the cards by winning the hands.
All cards are dealt among the players. Everyone takes their cards and puts them in piles face-down in front of them. The players turn over the first one at the same time. The card with the biggest animal wins the hand. If several animals are the same size, there is a “meow battle”! Each of the players in the battle places a new card face-down on top of their card and then another one face-up. The player with the highest card wins all the cards on the table. When one player has won all the cards, they win the game.

+++  There’s no need to know how to count – just compare the size of the cats!

—description from the publisher

Name: Mistigriff
Description:
A GAME OF PAIRS AND TACTICS
OBJECT: earn the most courage points
All of the cards are shuffled and dealt to the players. The player whose turn it is draws a card at random from his neighbour to the right. If they can make a pair, they lay the pair on the table before them. If one of the cards has a magical power, the power is immediately applied (play again, steal a pair, etc.). At the end of the game, each player counts up the courage points from the cards in front of them: whoever has the most points wins the game.

+++  A game of pairs with a tactical twist!

—description from the publisher

Name: DVolleyball
Description:
Dvolleyball closely resembles the real volleyball with his numerous possibilities. A player should know volleyball's basics to play DVolleyball.

In this game, volleyball sequence such as serve, pass, sets... are present Players will have to make decisions and will have to face randomness.

Name: A Fistful of Sardaukar
Description:
A Fistful of Sardaukar is a fast-play miniatures battle for tactical-scale combat in the universe of Frank Herbert's Dune novels.

The rules are quite simple and very deadly; the gist of the melee rules is that each side rolls 1d10, adds their combat skill, and the lower scorer is killed.

Name: Necromunda: The Book of Judgement
Description:
Necromunda is a world rife with lawlessness but the denizens of the underhive know the difference between the ongoing gang squabbles and true crime.

Expand your games of Necromunda with a wealth of new rules to add even more variety, scope and excitement to your battles in the underhive. With this book you can explore the never-ending conflict between elite officers of the law and the vast criminal organisations and enterprises of Necromunda.

Contents


     Crime on Necromunda: Extensive background on the vast criminal organisations and enterprises of Necromunda
     Palanite Enforcers: Rules for fielding these elite officers of the law in Necromunda
     Criminal Alliances: Rules for forming alliances with criminal organisations
     New Campaign: The Law and Misrule campaign presents a new way to play as gangs fight over control of criminal rackets
     Black Market: A huge selection of new weapons and wargear focusing on illegal and alien equipment for gangs to use
     Hired Guns: Add Psyreena Skar, Estus Jet, Cor 'Two Guns' Coran, Vunder Gorvos, Gaen 'The Gunk Queen' Gorvos and Jonny Razor to your gang


This is an expansion to Necromunda. The Necromunda Rulebook and Gangs of the Underhive are required to use the contents of this book.

—description from the publisher

Name: Metro Maps
Description:
Metro Maps is a board game all about building and matching shapes, while stopping your opponent from doing the same. Players must build stations and lines to complete the route shown on their card, it’s as simple as that. The tricky bit? You will need to combine multiple routes together as efficiently as possible while spending your resource cards in order to stand a chance of winning. Other players can block you at any time and if you don’t match your route exactly, you loose points.

Featuring artwork and gameplay inspired by the London Underground map, Metro Maps is a fast paced strategy game for between 2 and 4 players recommended for ages 13 to adult.

—description from the publisher

Name: Solvalla-travet
Description:
This is an extremely basic horse racing-themed betting game. It is named for the Solvalla racetrack in Stockholm and has no relation to later games using the name.

Players bet on one of six colours, the exact means of which are not specified or provided. A roulette wheel is then spun, assigning a number and thereby a relative position to each colour. Depending on the bets made and betting scheme agreed on beforehand (win or place), payments are made. You can then presumably continue in the same way for as long as you desire.

Probably sold in the 1940s or 1950s.

—user summary

Name: Choose Your Own Adventure: War with the Evil Power Master – Promo Kit: Game Convention
Description:
Promo Kit: Game Convention was available at GenCon 2019.

This comes with a Prologue card and 4 Starter Items to be included with the base game.

Name: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated – Bureaucratic Tome
Description:
The Bureaucratic Tome gives the controlling player an additional victory point for each other card in their deck that has three or more lines of game text.

This card was offered as a promo item at the Renegade Game Studios booth at Gencon 2019 and at Spiel 2019,

Name: Resa genom Sverige
Description:
Resa genom Sverige is a roll-and-move game themed as a journey through Sweden. It is clearly an adaptation of Reise durch Nord- und Mitteldeutschland from the same publisher, which is estimated to have been published in the 1950s.

As in its German counterpart, there are two sides to the board, showing northern and southern Sweden, each one a separate game. When landing on town spaces, players read interesting facts from separate sheets, then follow instructions in the rules. These include the old standbys of losing a turn or moving a number of spaces forward or back, but also instructions to pay coins (which presumably have been distributed before the game) to a pot.

There is a reference to dividing this pot after finishing the game, but the actual specifications are missing. (In the German game first place gets half, second place gets a third, third place gets the remainder.) Also, as in the German game, there's no special significance given to the result.

—user summary

Name: Problem Picnic: Attack of the Ants – T(ant)rum Promo
Description:
T(ant)rum is a promo round card that was originally created for the Tantrum House Season 4 Kickstarter campaign.

The card has the following ability:
"When you get this card, take any Round card that was not in the game or that has already been used and discarded. Keep it as if you'd drawn that one instead of this one, and discard this one."
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada
